Pre-Game Insights: Germany are going through a big transition period after several senior players announced their retirements from international football.
Julian Nagelsmann has announced Joshua Kimmich as the new captain of the German team.
Germany will now focus on a younger core with players like Florian Wirtz and Jamal Musiala leading the new generation.
Hungary, led by Liverpool's Dominik Szoboszlai, aim to bounce back after a disappointing run in the Euro 2024.
Hungary's first match in the UEFA Nations League is an away trip to Germany, followed by a home clash against Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Kai Havertz has impressed with his performances in the number nine role, netting 14 goals and providing seven assists last season.
Dominik Szoboszlai has emerged as an important member of the Hungarian national team, thriving in his role as captain.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany are unbeaten in their last six home games.
Hungary have scored just six goals in their last five matches.
Germany secured a 2-0 win over Hungary the last time they faced each other.
Others: Germany's predicted lineup: Ter Stegen (GK); Kimmich, Tah, Schlotterbeck, Mittelstadt; Andrich, Pavlovic; Musiala, Stiller, Wirtz; Havertz.
Hungary's predicted lineup: Gulacsi (GK); Botka, Orban, Dardai; Bolla, Nagy, Schafer, Kerkez; Szoboszlai, Sallai; Varga.
Telecast information: India – Sony Sports Network, SonyLIV; UK – ITVX, Premier Sports; US – FOX Sports App, Fox Sports 2; Nigeria – SuperSport, DStv Now.
